de.esoco.lib.app

Class Service

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.app.Application
        • de.esoco.lib.app.Service
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stoppable, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RestService

    public abstract class Service
extends Application
implements Stoppable
    An application subclass that is the abstract base for the implementation of services that can be controlled via REST interface over a network connection. The network interface is implemented by means of the Server class. If the service implements the AuthenticationService interface it will be used to authenticate all requests to the REST interface and reject all unauthenticated requests.

    There are two ways to run a service, controlled by the boolean parameter of the constructor. Either as a REST service implemented by the HTTP control server or as an explicit service functionality that must be implemented in the runService() method.

    If used as a REST service or to extend the control server functionality a subclass can modify the ObjectSpace that provides the REST server functionality in the method buildRestServerSpace(). By default the REST server contains several sub-spaces under the following relation types:

    • API: the server API which maps all values from and to JSON. This contains the following sub-spaces:
      • STATUS: a read-only space that provides informations about the current service status.
      • CONTROL: a writable space that allows to control the server at runtime. The most notable element in that space is the RUN flag which can be set to FALSE to stop the service.
    • WEBAPI: a HTML representation of API.

    Furthermore the URLs /ping and /healthcheck can be queried for the availability and healthiness of the service. By default both return a boolean with the value TRUE but subclasses may replace the HEALTHCHECK relation with their own variant that contains additional JSON data.

    The REST server of a service by default always runs with TLS encryption. By setting the no encryption option on the command line this can be disabled for testing purposes.

      • Service

        public Service()
        Creates a new instance for a service with a #runApp.

      • Service

        protected Service(boolean bIsRestService)
        Creates a new instance or a sub-class.
        Parameters:
        bIsRestService - TRUE if this instance should be run as a single REST service implemented by the REST server; FALSE to have separate service functionality in the main thread (by implementing runService() and the REST server in a separate thread

    • Method Detail

      • runService

        protected abstract void runService()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Will be invoked to run the actual service after the application has been initialized and configured. This method needs to be implemented if the service has it's own functionality to be run on the main thread. If the service is only using the REST server as a REST service implementation this method can remain empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs during execution

      • buildApiSpace

        protected org.obrel.space.ObjectSpace<java.lang.Object> buildApiSpace(org.obrel.space.ObjectSpace<java.lang.Object> aStatusSpace,
                                                                      org.obrel.space.ObjectSpace<java.lang.Object> aControlSpace)
        Builds the object space that provides the REST API of this service.
        Parameters:
        aStatusSpace - The status space to be queried through the API
        aControlSpace - The control space to be accessed through the API
        Returns:
        The control object space

      • buildRestServerSpace

        protected org.obrel.space.ObjectSpace<java.lang.Object> buildRestServerSpace()
        Builds the ObjectSpace for the REST server. The REST server uses this to perform control requests and to lookup status responses.
        Returns:
        The new REST object space

      • createRequestHandler

        protected Server.RequestHandler createRequestHandler(org.obrel.core.Relatable rContext)
        Must be implemented to create new instances of Server.RequestHandler for the REST server of this service. If the subclass implements the AuthenticationService interface it will be set on the request handler with the SecurityRelationTypes.AUTHENTICATION_SERVICE relation type to perform request authentications. If authentication is required but implemented by a different class the subclass must override this method to set the above relation on the request handler by itself.
        Parameters:
        rContext - The service context
        Returns:
        A new request handler instance

      • createRequestMethodHandler

        protected HttpRequestHandler.HttpRequestMethodHandler createRequestMethodHandler()
        Creates a new instance of HttpRequestHandler.HttpRequestMethodHandler. See the method getRequestMethodHandler() for more details. The default implementation returns an instance of ObjectSpaceHttpMethodHandler.
        Returns:
        The new request method handler

      • createRestServer

        protected Server createRestServer()
        Creates a new REST server that returns status information and allows to control this service.
        Returns:
        The new server instance, initialized but not started

      • getRequestMethodHandler

        protected HttpRequestHandler.HttpRequestMethodHandler getRequestMethodHandler()
        Will be invoked to return the handler for HTTP request methods (like GET, PUT, etc.). The default implementation creates only a single handler (by invoking createRequestMethodHandler() which will then be reused for all requests, expecting the handler to be stateless. If an application needs stateful method handlers it must override this method and return a new handler instance on each invocation.
        Returns:
        The request method handler

      • getRestRequestHandlerFactory

        protected Server.RequestHandlerFactory getRestRequestHandlerFactory()
        Will be invoked to query the Server.RequestHandlerFactory to be used for the REST server of this service. The default implementation creates a factory that invokes createRequestHandler(Relatable).
        Returns:
        The REST request handler factory

      • getRestServerPort

        protected int getRestServerPort()
        Will be invoked to query the REST server port. The default implementation looks for the command line option 'port' and tries to convert it to a integer value. If this is not possible or the option is missing an exception will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The REST server port

      • getRestSpace

        protected final org.obrel.space.ObjectSpace<java.lang.Object> getRestSpace()
        Returns the REST object space of this service.
        Returns:
        The REST object space

        Parameters:
        rStartDate - The start date of the service
        Returns:
        The service information string

      • getServiceName

        protected java.lang.String getServiceName()
        Can be overridden to return a description string for this service instance. The default implementation returns the class name without package.
        Returns:
        The service description string
